symptoms.name: Blisters
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases, containing sticky clear fluid

physical_findings: Erythema and diffuse white scaling on the palmar aspect of the hand
White scales localized to palmar skin furrows and adjoining dermatoglyphics
Dotted vessels in the skin furrows (seen with immersion fluid in dermoscopy)
risk_factors: Contact with other fungal infections (e.g., tinea pedis, tinea cruris)

Dermoscopy: White scales accentuated in skin furrows and adjoining dermatoglyphics
Dotted vessels localized to skin furrows (with immersion fluid)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with tinea manuum (erythema, scaling, itching)
Positive KOH examination showing septate hyphae
supportive: Dermoscopic findings: white scales in skin furrows, dotted vessels in furrows
